result.execSummary:
The defendant MICHAEL R. LOSSE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and fingerprints and photograph pursuant to Wis. Stats. 970.02(7).  IMMEDIATELY following court, contact (920) 236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  Arrangements to complete collection shall be made within 72 hours.  At time of appointment, Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.
Expungement authorized upon full payment of fine and costs.
PAID IN FULL.  REMAINDER SHALL BE RETURNED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MICHAEL R. LOSSE

records.addlTxt: Letter to Def. informing of over payment of fine and providing copy of Order for Expungement.

records.descr: Order on Pet. to Expunge Court Rec. of Conviction

records.addlTxt: Proof of payment of fine and costs

11:00 a.m.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL LOSSE in court.  Defendant provides proof of payment of fine and costs and moves for expungement.  Expungement granted.

9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael R. Losse in court. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with. Victim appears and make sentencing statement.  State recommends expungement.  Court finds expungement is appropriate.

9:20 AM  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL R. LOSSE in court.   Advised of and waives rights.  Copy of complaint received by Def.  Marcy's law complied with. Defendant wishes to accept offer of fine and costs and proceed to sentencing.
to appear on Tuesday, August 02, 2022 at 9:15 am - Branch 2
